recipe.title: Korean BBQ
recipe.description: A popular Korean dish featuring grilled meats, served with various side dishes.
ingredients: 1 lb (450g) thinly sliced beef (ribeye, sirloin, or brisket)
Assorted vegetables for grilling (e.g., bell peppers, mushrooms, onions)
Cooked rice and lettuce leaves for serving
instructions: 1. In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, minced garlic, minced ginger, rice wine, and black pepper to make the marinade.
2. Place the thinly sliced beef in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over it. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight for best results.
3. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Grill the marinated beef slices for 1-2 minutes on each side until cooked through and slightly charred.
4. Grill the assorted vegetables until tender.
5. Serve the grilled beef and vegetables with cooked rice and lettuce leaves. Wrap the beef and vegetables in lettuce leaves and enjoy!

recipe.title: Bibimbap
recipe.description: A traditional Korean mixed rice dish topped with assorted vegetables, meat, and a fried egg.
ingredients: 1 cup assorted vegetables (e.g., spinach, carrots, bean sprouts, mushrooms, zucchini)
instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, and minced garlic to make the marinade. Add the thinly sliced beef and marinate for 20-30 minutes.
2. Prepare the assorted vegetables by blanching or stir-frying them until tender-crisp. Season with salt and sesame oil.
3. Fry the eggs sunny-side up or over-easy.
4. To assemble bibimbap, place a serving of cooked rice in a bowl. Arrange the assorted vegetables, marinated beef, and fried egg on top of the rice.
5. Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions. Serve with gochujang on the side for extra flavor.
6. Mix everything together before eating. Enjoy!

recipe.title: Kimchi Fried Rice
recipe.description: A delicious Korean dish made with fried rice and kimchi.
ingredients: 1/2 cup cooked protein (e.g., chicken, pork, tofu)
instructions: 1. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. Add chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet. Cook until fragrant and onions are translucent.
3. Add chopped kimchi and cook for 2-3 minutes.
4. Add cooked rice to the skillet and break up any clumps.
5. Stir in kimchi juice, soy sauce, sesame oil, and sugar (if using). Mix well to combine.
6. Add cooked protein (e.g., chicken, pork, tofu) and green onions to the skillet. Stir until everything is heated through.
7. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper if needed.
8. Garnish with sesame seeds before serving.
9. Serve hot and enjoy!
